1900320.book: The Combing Of The Hair Of Rasoolullah
1900320.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900320
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 001
1900320.text: A’isha said: “I used to comb the hair of Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) while I was menstruating.”

1900330.book: The Combing Of The Hair Of Rasoolullah
1900330.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900330
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 002
1900330.text: Anas ibn Malik said: “Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) made a frequent practice of oiling his head and combing his beard, and he often wore the head veil, so it was as if his robe was the robe of an oil dealer.”

1900340.book: The Combing Of The Hair Of Rasoolullah
1900340.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900340
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 003
1900340.text: 'A’isha said: “Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to love tayammun [beginning with his right hand, his right side and his right foot] in his ritual purification when he purified himself, in his combing when he combed his hair, and putting on his shoes when he donned them.”

1900350.book: The Combing Of The Hair Of Rasoolullah
1900350.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900350
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 004
1900350.text: 'Abdullah ibn Mughaffal said: "Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) forbade combing except at intervals.”

1900360.book: The Combing Of The Hair Of Rasoolullah
1900360.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900360
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 005
1900360.text: Humaid ibn 'Abd ar-Rahman relates on the authority of a man from among the Companions of the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace): "The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to comb his hair at intervals.”
